qas.question: In what language was most of Ibn Sina's works written in?

context: <b5_0><b8_0>Ibn Sīnā<b8_0/><b5_0/> wrote extensively on early Islamic philosophy, especially the subjects logic, <a1_0><b10_0>ethics<b10_0/><a1_0/>, and metaphysics, including treatises named Logic and <a4_0><b13_0>Metaphysics<b13_0/><a4_0/>. Most of his works were written in <a0_0><b9_0>Arabic<b9_0/><a0_0/> – then the language of science in the <b6_0>Middle East<b6_0/> – and some in <a2_0><b11_0>Persian<b11_0/><a2_0/>. Of linguistic significance even to this day are a few books that he wrote in nearly pure Persian language (particularly the Danishnamah-yi 'Ala', Philosophy for Ala' ad-Dawla'). Ibn Sīnā's commentaries on <a3_0><b7_0><b12_0>Aristotle<b12_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/> often criticized the philosopher,[citation needed] encouraging a lively debate in the spirit of ijtihad.
